author: Morgan Housel
summary: The highest form of wealth is the ability to wake up every morning and say 'I can do whatever I want today.' Controlling your time is the highest dividend money pays and the strongest predictor of happiness.
key_takeaways: Control over your time is the highest dividend money pays.
Having a sense of control over your life is the strongest predictor of happiness.
Doing something you love on a schedule you can't control can feel like doing something you hate.

questions.question: What is the strongest predictor of positive feelings of wellbeing?

options.text: Having a strong sense of controlling one's life

questions.explanation: Psychologist Angus Campbell found that having a strong sense of controlling one's life is a more dependable predictor of positive feelings of wellbeing than any objective conditions of life.

questions.question: Why might Americans feel MORE stressed today despite being wealthier than in the 1950s?

options.text: We've traded control over our time for more money and bigger stuff
Modern medicine has increased anxiety disorders
There are fewer jobs available today

questions.explanation: We've used our greater wealth to buy bigger and better stuff, but we've simultaneously given up more control over our time. At best, those things cancel each other out.

questions.question: Why do modern knowledge workers often feel like they're working 24/7, even with shorter office hours?

options.text: Their bosses demand more overtime than ever
Their tool is their brain, which never leaves them, so work thoughts follow them everywhere
Social media makes it impossible to disconnect
They lack proper time management skills

questions.explanation: If your job is decision-making and thought-based, your tool is your head, which never leaves you. You might think about work during your commute, making dinner, or at 3am. The modern factory is the day itself.
